title: Dress Clip, before December 1937
medium: Glass rhinestones, rhodium plated base metal
markings: "KTF" monogram on the backside. Underneath the clasp there is another marking reading "15" with "A. Philippe" below. The "15" mark dates these two clips (1997-146-7) before December 1937. Though only one of the clips is signed, it is clear that they are of the same design, materials and maker.
provenance: Per letter from donor, this clip was owned and worn by donor's mother, Fredericka Freidman Steinbach, pruchased by her in the 1930s from Milgrims ("ladies specialty shop on 57th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues", NYC).
dimensions: Overall: 3.5 x 2.8 x 1 cm (1 3/8 x 1 1/8 x 3/8 in.)
creditline: Gift of Sally Steinbach Israel in memory of Fredricka Friedman Steinbach
description:
Shield-shaped dress clip comprised of ninety-two brilliant-cut glass rhinestones and nie baguette-cut rhinestones encased in a visible rhodium plated base metal (a less expensive member of the platinum family). 

This clip (and it's mate 1997-146-7) are symmetrical, monochromatic and characteristic of the geometric Art Deco style and 'white jewelry' trend sof the 1930s.

tombstone.epitaph:
Dress Clip, before December 1937.
before December 1937. Glass rhinestones, rhodium plated base metal. Gift of Sally Steinbach Israel in memory of Fredricka Friedman Steinbach. 1995-134-6.
